description.narrative: 5.2. By 2021, National, sub-national and community-level education stakeholders have improved capacity to deliver quality learning in targeted provinces especially at the primary level, which contributes to Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 5. By 2021, boys and girls of school-going age demonstrate improved learning outcomes as a result of equitable and inclusive access to quality education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.2. By 2021, National, sub-national and community-level education stakeholders have improved capacity to deliver quality learning in targeted provinces especially at the primary level

description.narrative: Learning was enhanced through a Literacy and Numeracy Programme that reached 251,418 learners across 1,877 schools in Eastern and Southern Provinces. A total of 2,480 teachers from 763 schools had capacity built in the Catch-Up teaching methodology while 127 district and provincial staff had capacity built in data management. Work supporting the review of sector dialogue mechanisms was completed while support to strengthening Joint Sector Review, harmonising literacy and numeracy programming and strengthening teacher education support commenced. 140 disadvantaged schools in Southern Province were supported with safe and protective measures for smooth school reopening amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/06/2020
